title: Nationals Take NLCS Opener After a Pitching Gem
text:
ST. LOUIS—The Washington Nationals arrived at this moment because of the power of their pitching rotation. Max Scherzer, Stephen Strasburg and Patrick Corbin enabled them to overcome a 19-31 start, a dismal bullpen and even the mighty Los Angeles Dodgers in the first round of the playoffs. That trio of aces brought the Nationals to the doorstep of the World Series and could propel them to the franchise’s first title.

So it comes as no surprise that a member of the Nationals carried a no-hitter into the eighth inning in Game...
description: Aníbal Sánchez delivered an unexpected October masterpiece—allowing only one hit in Washington’s 2-0 win over St. Louis in Game 1 of the NLCS.
